column1: … = data not available; | = marks break in the series; – = magnitude equals zero; * = provisional, preliminary, estimate, budget figure; 0 or 0.0 = magnitude is less than half of unit employed; $ = United States dollars; cif = cost, insurance, and freight; fob = freight on board; GDP = gross domestic product; GNI = gross national income; IMF = International Monetary Fund; km2 = square kilometer; kWh = kilowatt-hour; L = liter; NPISHs = nonprofit institutions serving households; Rp = rupiah; SDRs = special drawing rights; t = metric ton; TJ = terajoule.

column2: Projections based on census or survey figures, except for 2005 and 2010, which are the actual figures from intercensal population survey and population census respectively.
For 2010 onward, data are based on the 2008 System of National Accounts. Base year was also changed from 2000 to 2010.

For 2006 onward, data were derived using the conversion factor of 1 metric ton = 7.33 barrels, 1 ton = 41.868 terajoules, 1 million standard cubic feet (MMscf) = 1.05 terajoules, and 1 Million British Thermal Unit (MBTU) = 1.0551 x 10-3 terajoules.
For 2000–2002, data refer to the consumer price index (CPI) for 43 cities; for 2003–2007, 45 cities; for 2008–2013, 66 cities; and for 2014–2018, 82 cities.

Refers to Indonesia's CPI group "Foodstuff" consisting of cereals, cassava, and related products; meat and related products; fresh fish; preserved fish; eggs, milk, and related products; vegetables; beans and nuts; fruits; spices; fats and oils; and other food items. The group does not include nonalcoholic and alcoholic beverages.
Refers to Indonesia's CPI group "Prepared Food, Beverages, and Tobacco Products", and includes nonalcoholic and alcoholic beverages.
Refers to Indonesia's CPI group "Housing, Water, Electricity, Gas, and Fuel", which includes "Household Equipment" and "Household Operation".
Refers to Indonesia's CPI group "Transport, Communication, and Financial Services".
Distributed into the other commodity groups and/or subgroups.
Change of the wholesale price index for 2013 was estimated by rebasing January–October 2013 and 2012 data to 2005.
Refers to current accounts, transfer, and mature time deposits and savings deposits in rupiah, held by residents within the monetary system.
For 2004–2012, figures include securities other than shares. For  2013 onward, "securities other than shares" are excluded.
Includes import deposits and other items (net).
Shown in the consolidated balance sheets of commercial banks.
Refers to claims of public sector, private enterprises, and individuals.
Refers to time deposits in deposit money banks (weighted average).
